com.gilran.chess.board

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gilran.chess.board.Piece

extends java.lang.Object
    A chess piece.
    Author:
    Gil Ran

    • Field Detail

      • type

        protected Piece.Type type
        The type of the piece.

      • color

        protected Piece.Color color
        The color of the piece.

      • movesMap

        protected com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<Coordinate,com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Move>> movesMap
        A map of legal moves from each coordinate on the board.

        The list is pre-calculated, and kept as a member of each of the static pieces. Having that there is a small amount of piece types (6), two colors, and 64 coordinates on the board, this data is not very big (6*2*64=768 moves total). It seems better to pre-calculate it and consume more memory than to perform for each move an action that is O(P*N), with P being the number of pieces on the board and P being the length of one edge of the board.

      • PIECES

        private static final com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<Piece.Color,com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<Piece.Type,Piece>> PIECES
        Static map of all pieces.

        The number of pieces is small, and all pieces can be held in memoery at all times. This would prevent duplicate instances of the same piece, and would save some garbage collection.

      • initMovesMap

        protected void initMovesMap()
        Initializer for the moves map.

        Each sub-class must call this method from its constructor.

        This method uses abstract method calculateMoves, therefore it is not called from the constructor of the base-class.

      • getType

        public Piece.Type getType()
        Returns the piece type.

      • getColor

        public Piece.Color getColor()
        Returns the piece color.

      • moves

        public java.util.List<Move> moves(Coordinate from)
        Returns a list of all the possible moves that this piece can make from the given coordinate. This list of moves does not take into consideration the position of other pieces of the board, and can be used as a list of candidate moves to check against a specific position.
        Parameters:
        from - The coordinate from which the moves are made.
        Returns:
        A list of all possible moves from the give coordinate.

      • calculateMoves

        protected abstract com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Move> calculateMoves(Coordinate from)
        Calcualtes the legal moves of the piece from the given coordinate. The returned moves are all of the piece's legal moves, regardless of the board position, as the piece does not know the board position. It is the role of Position to remove from the returned list any moves that are illegal in the specific board position.

      • otherColor

        public static Piece.Color otherColor(Piece.Color color)
        Returns the other (opposite) color from the one given.

      • addMove

        protected static void addMove(Coordinate from,
           Coordinate to,
           com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList.Builder<Move> listBuilder)
        Creates a new move and adds it to the list builder. If one of the coordinates is null, a move is not created or added.
        Parameters:
        from - The from coordinate of the move.
        to - The to coordinate of the move.
        listBuilder - The list builder to which the move is added.

      • addMovesSeries

        protected static void addMovesSeries(Coordinate from,
                  int files,
                  int ranks,
                  com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList.Builder<Move> listBuilder)
        Adds moves to the moves list builder, where each move is to one (files, ranks) step from the previous move's to, and must have all previous moves' to coordinates unoccupied.
        Parameters:
        from - The current piece coordinate.
        files - The number of files per move.
        ranks - The number of ranks per move.
        listBuilder - The list builder to which the moves are added.
